definitions.definition: an act of using violence to try to hurt or kill somebody
definitions.sensetop: attack on/upon somebody/somethingattack against somebodyattack by somebody/something

examples.text: Five people were killed in the attacks that took place last night.
the recent series of deadly **terrorist attacks** on European cities
a violent attack upon a police officer
vicious attacks against defenceless people
A child is recovering in hospital after a serious attack by a stray dog.
He was subjected to a violent attack.
Two teenagers carried out a frenzied attack on a local shopkeeper.
Where did the attack happen?
an attack by an armed gang
an increase in knife attacks on police officers

definitions.definition: an act of trying to kill or injure the enemy in war, using weapons such as guns and bombs
definitions.sensetop: attack on somebody/somethingattack against somebody/somethingunder attack (from somebody/something)

examples.text: a **bomb/rocket/missile attack**
Rebel forces **launched an attack** on civilian targets.
Commanders attempted to prevent an attack against the city.
The patrol **came under attack** from all sides.
Bombers pressed home their attack, causing severe damage to harbour installations.
Most of the population would stand little chance of surviving a nuclear attack.
The administration may launch a pre-emptive attack against terrorist bases.
The attack took place under cover of darkness.
The border towns have suffered a series of attacks.
The soldiers mounted an all-out attack on the town.
They came under sustained attack from the air.
an attack on enemy positions

definitions.definition: a sudden, short period of illness, usually severe

examples.text: to **suffer an** asthma **attack**
an attack of fever

definitions.definition: a sudden period of feeling an emotion such as fear

examples.text: a **panic attack**
an attack of nerves
He suffers from attacks of anxiety.
an attack of conscience *(= a guilty feeling about something you have done or are planning to do)*
an attack of the giggles

definitions.definition: strong criticism of somebody/something in speech or in writing
definitions.sensetop: attack on somebody/somethingunder attack (from somebody/something) (for something/for doing something)

examples.text: He found himself the **victim of an** unprovoked **attack** by the media.
She has **laid herself **wide **open to attack**.
It was seen as a **personal attack** on the president.
The school has **come under attack** for failing to encourage bright students.
examples.contextForm: under attack (from somebody/something) (for something/for doing something)

examples.text: Doctors have **gone on the attack**, accusing the government of incompetence.
The government's decision has provoked an attack from leaders of the health service.
The first line of attack is often name-calling.

definitions.definition: the players in a team whose job is to try to score goals or points

examples.text: Germany's attack has been weakened by the loss of some key players through injury.

definitions.definition: the actions that players take to try to score a goal or win the game

examples.text: a sustained attack on the Arsenal goal

definitions.definition: an action that you take to try to stop or change something that you feel is bad

examples.text: to **launch an** all-out **attack** on poverty/unemployment

definitions.definition: the action of something such as an insect, or a disease, that causes damage to something/somebody

examples.text: The roof timbers were affected by rot and insect attack.

wordOrigin: early 17th cent.: from French attaque (noun), attaquer (verb), from Italian attacco ‘an attack’, attaccare ‘join battle’, based on an element of Germanic origin (see attach).
